newsitem.title: USA: Zycad sees Q1 rev shortfall, oper loss.
newsitem.headline: Zycad sees Q1 rev shortfall, oper loss.

text.p: Zycad Corp said it expects to report a significant revenue shortfall in the first quarter of fiscal 1997, resulting in a signficant operating loss for the quarter.
Revenues are expected to be in the range of $4 million.

It also said it made significant cost reductions in its verification business by downsizing its employee base by about 25 percent, partially due to the sale of its LightSpeed product line to IKOS Systems Inc.
It said the revenue shortfall was due to the sale and a general slow-down in capital purchases.

Zycad also said it agreed to sell its approximately 20 percent holding in Quality Systems and Software Inc (QSS) for $3,500,000. The QSS holdings resulted from the product line that was spun-off from Zycad Corp in the fourth quarter of 1995. This financial transaction is expected to close during the second quarter.
